abstract.text: Returns a font reference that most accurately maps the string range based on the current font and language.

specifying the range of the string to map.
A language identifier to select a font for a particular localization.
The best substitute font that can encode the specified string range.

The current font itself can be returned if it covers the string provided. If the caller does not specify the language parameter, the function uses the current system language. The format of the language identifier should conform to

abstract.text: Create text layouts, optimize font handling, and access font metrics and glyph data.
Returns the Unicode character set of the font.
Returns a new font with additional attributes based on the original font.
Returns a new font in the specified family based on the traits of the original font.
Returns a new font in the same font family as the original with the specified symbolic traits.
Returns a font reference that most accurately maps the string range based on the current font.
Returns a font reference that most accurately maps the string range based on the current font and language.
Returns the special user-interface font for the given language and user-interface type.
Returns a new font reference that best matches the given font descriptor.
Returns a new font reference that best matches the given font descriptor.
Returns a new font reference for the given name.
Returns a new font reference for the given name.
The cascade list used for a font reference.
A structure representing a range of sequential items in a container, such as characters in a buffer or elements in a collection.
A structure representing a range of sequential items in a container, such as characters in a buffer or elements in a collection.
A reference to a CFString object.
